title: Joshua Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Joshua with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 24 chapters.

questions.question: Who was appointed as the leader of Israel after the death of Moses?
questions.explanation: Joshua, the son of Nun, was appointed by God to lead Israel after Moses' death.

questions.question: What command did the LORD give Joshua concerning the Book of the Law?
options: To read it once a year
To meditate on it day and night
To hide it from the people
questions.correctAnswer: To meditate on it day and night
questions.explanation: God commanded Joshua to keep the Book of the Law always on his lips and meditate on it day and night for success.

questions.question: How many days did Joshua command the people to prepare victuals before crossing the Jordan?
questions.explanation: Joshua instructed the people to prepare food because they would cross the Jordan in three days.

questions.question: To which tribes did Joshua speak about helping their brethren possess the land?
options: Reuben, Gad, and half tribe of Manasseh
questions.correctAnswer: Reuben, Gad, and half tribe of Manasseh
questions.explanation: Joshua reminded these tribes to assist their brethren until all the land was possessed.

questions.question: What was the people's response to Joshua's command to be strong and courageous?
options: They agreed to obey all his commands
questions.correctAnswer: They agreed to obey all his commands
questions.explanation: The people pledged to obey Joshua as they did Moses, asking for God's presence to be with him.

questions.question: What miraculous event happened when the priests carrying the Ark stepped into the Jordan river?
options: The waters stood still and the river stopped flowing
questions.correctAnswer: The waters stood still and the river stopped flowing
questions.explanation: When the priests carrying the Ark stepped into the Jordan, the waters stopped flowing allowing Israel to cross on dry ground.

questions.question: How many stones did Joshua command the Israelites to take from the Jordan river?
questions.explanation: Joshua told twelve men, one from each tribe, to take twelve stones as a memorial of the crossing.

questions.question: What was the significance of the twelve stones set up at Gilgal?
options: To mark the boundary of Israel's land
To serve as a memorial for the crossing of the Jordan river
questions.correctAnswer: To serve as a memorial for the crossing of the Jordan river
questions.explanation: The stones were set up as a witness to future generations of God's miraculous help.

questions.question: How long did the manna cease after the Israelites crossed the Jordan?
questions.explanation: Manna ceased seven days after they ate the produce of the land.

questions.question: Who met Joshua and declared himself the captain of the LORD's host?
questions.explanation: Joshua encountered a man with a drawn sword who identified himself as commander of the LORD's army.

questions.question: How many days did the Israelites march around the city of Jericho before the walls fell?
questions.explanation: They marched once around the city for six days, then seven times on the seventh day.

questions.question: What were the priests carrying as they marched around Jericho?
options: Trumpets and the Ark of the Covenant
questions.correctAnswer: Trumpets and the Ark of the Covenant
questions.explanation: Seven priests carried seven trumpets of rams' horns before the Ark of the Covenant.

questions.question: What caused the walls of Jericho to fall down flat?
options: The Israelites' shouting after the trumpet blast
The priests blowing trumpets continuously for hours
questions.correctAnswer: The Israelites' shouting after the trumpet blast
questions.explanation: After the priests blew a long blast, the people shouted, and the walls fell flat.

questions.question: Who was spared from the destruction of Jericho because she hid the spies?
questions.explanation: Rahab and her family were spared because she protected the Israelite spies.

questions.question: What was Joshua's curse regarding anyone who rebuilt the city of Jericho?
options: He would be struck by lightning
His firstborn would be killed and youngest son would set up its gates
He would be put to death by the king
questions.correctAnswer: His firstborn would be killed and youngest son would set up its gates
questions.explanation: Joshua pronounced a curse that the one who rebuilt Jericho would lose his firstborn and youngest son.

questions.question: Which city was the head of all kingdoms and was burned by Joshua?
questions.explanation: Hazor was the head of all kingdoms and was burned by Joshua as commanded.

questions.question: Against what alliance of kings did Joshua fight at the waters of Merom?
options: Kings from the north, east, and west including Amorites and Hittites
questions.correctAnswer: Kings from the north, east, and west including Amorites and Hittites
questions.explanation: Jabin king of Hazor gathered many kings from different regions to fight Israel.

questions.question: What did the LORD command Joshua to do with the horses and chariots of the defeated kings?
options: Hough the horses and burn the chariots
Use them for the army of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Hough the horses and burn the chariots
questions.explanation: God instructed Joshua to disable the horses by cutting their hamstrings and burn the chariots.

questions.question: Which inhabitants made peace with Israel instead of fighting?
questions.explanation: The Hivites who lived in Gibeon made peace and were spared from battle.

questions.question: What was the LORD's purpose in hardening the hearts of the Canaanite kings to fight Israel?
options: To destroy them utterly as commanded
questions.correctAnswer: To destroy them utterly as commanded
questions.explanation: God hardened their hearts so they would come against Israel and be destroyed as commanded by Moses.

questions.question: What happened to the Anakims after Joshua's conquest?
options: They were completely destroyed except a few in Gaza, Gath, and Ashdod
questions.correctAnswer: They were completely destroyed except a few in Gaza, Gath, and Ashdod
questions.explanation: Joshua cut off the Anakims from the mountains but some remained in those three cities.

questions.question: How did the Israelites divide the land they conquered?
options: According to the number of men in each tribe
Equally by size for each family
They did not divide the land
questions.explanation: The land was divided by lot among the tribes as commanded by the LORD through Moses and Joshua.

questions.question: Who was the leader of the tribe of Ephraim mentioned in the book of Joshua?
questions.explanation: Joshua was from the tribe of Ephraim and served as its leader during the conquest.

questions.question: What was the main theme of Joshua's farewell address at Shechem?
options: Remember the law and choose whom you will serve
Prepare for battle against remaining kings
questions.correctAnswer: Remember the law and choose whom you will serve
questions.explanation: Joshua challenged the people to choose to serve the LORD or other gods.

questions.question: What did Joshua do to renew the covenant between Israel and the LORD?
options: Built an altar and read the law
Made a peace treaty with neighbors
questions.correctAnswer: Built an altar and read the law
questions.explanation: Joshua built an altar on Mount Ebal and read the blessings and curses of the law.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Be strong and of a good courage: be not afraid, neither be thou dismayed: for the LORD thy God is with thee whithersoever thou ______.'
questions.explanation: God encouraged Joshua to be courageous because He would be with him wherever he went.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'This book of the law shall not depart out of thy mouth; but thou shalt ______ therein day and night.'
questions.explanation: Joshua was instructed to meditate on the law day and night for success.

questions.question: True or False: Joshua commanded the people to shout only after the priests blew the trumpets on the seventh day around Jericho.
questions.explanation: Joshua instructed the people not to shout until he gave the command on the seventh day.

questions.question: True or False: The Israelites destroyed all the cities they conquered without exception.
questions.explanation: They spared the Gibeonites who made peace with Israel.

questions.question: True or False: Joshua was afraid and dismayed when he encountered the captain of the LORD's host.
questions.explanation: Joshua fell on his face in reverence but was not afraid.

questions.question: True or False: The manna continued to fall throughout the entire conquest of Canaan.
questions.explanation: Manna ceased seven days after they ate the produce of the land.

questions.question: True or False: The LORD promised Joshua that no man would be able to stand before him all the days of his life.
questions.explanation: God assured Joshua that He would be with him as He was with Moses.

questions.question: True or False: Joshua destroyed the city of Ai completely after the first attempt to capture it.
questions.explanation: Israel was defeated the first time due to Achan's sin; Ai was destroyed after a second attack.

questions.question: True or False: The priests carrying the Ark of the Covenant went before the people as they crossed the Jordan river.
questions.explanation: The priests went ahead carrying the Ark into the river, causing the waters to stop.

questions.question: True or False: The Israelites took plunder from Jericho including silver and gold for themselves.
questions.explanation: Silver, gold, and vessels were consecrated to the LORD's treasury, not taken as plunder.

questions.question: True or False: Joshua renewed the covenant with Israel at Shechem before his death.
questions.explanation: Joshua gathered the people at Shechem to renew their commitment to serve the LORD.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Cursed be the man that riseth up and buildeth this city Jericho: he shall lay the foundation thereof in his ______.'
questions.explanation: Joshua pronounced a curse that the builder would lose his firstborn and youngest son.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'And the LORD said unto Joshua, Be not afraid, neither be thou dismayed: take all the people of war with thee, and arise, go up to ______.'
questions.explanation: God commanded Joshua to attack Ai after the sin of Achan was dealt with.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Choose you this day whom ye will serve; but as for me and my house, we will serve the ______.'
questions.explanation: Joshua declared his family's commitment to serve the LORD.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'For the LORD your God, he is God in heaven above, and in the earth beneath: there is none else.'
questions.explanation: This affirms the LORD's unique sovereignty over all.

questions.question: Who was the father of Joshua?
questions.explanation: Joshua is identified as the son of Nun.

questions.question: What did Joshua do with the spoils from the cities he conquered?
questions.explanation: The spoil and cattle were taken by the children of Israel as prey for themselves.

questions.question: How did Joshua cause the sun and moon to stand still during battle?
options: By a miracle of God upon his prayer
This event is not recorded in Joshua
questions.correctAnswer: By a miracle of God upon his prayer
questions.explanation: Joshua prayed and God made the sun stand still to prolong the day.

questions.question: What was the significance of the altar built by the Israelites on Mount Ebal?
options: To renew the covenant with the LORD
To commemorate the crossing of the Jordan
questions.correctAnswer: To renew the covenant with the LORD
questions.explanation: The altar was built according to Moses' instruction to confirm the covenant.

questions.question: True or False: Joshuaâ€™s fame spread throughout all the country after the fall of Jericho.
questions.explanation: The LORD was with Joshua, and his fame was widely known.
